Class DependableStage

java.lang.Object
javafx.stage.Window
javafx.stage.Stage
com.tom.jpedit.gui.DependableStage
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.event.EventTarget
Direct Known Subclasses:
JPEditWindow
public abstract class DependableStage extends javafx.stage.Stage
A DependableStage is a Stage that can have dependents. A dependent is a Stage that cannot exist without its owner. If a DependableStage closes then all of its dependents must also close

Circular dependencies are allowed as the methods involved check for this and prevent run-away closing

  • Constructor Details

    • DependableStage

      public DependableStage()

  • Method Details

    • close

      public void close()
      Closes the stage but first closes every stage that depends on this stage.

      When this stage begins closing, closing is set to true. Every dependent stage is then closed. This is done by firing a WindowEvent.WINDOW_CLOSE_REQUEST event on all dependent Stages. This method is capable of checking for circular dependencies and will not cause run-away closing to throw StackOverflowError

      After all dependents are closed, this stage closes.

      Overrides:
      close in class javafx.stage.Stage

    • isClosing

      public boolean isClosing()
      Used to determine if a DependableStage is in the process of closing.

      This helps to prevent run-away closing if two dependable stages depend on each other

      Returns:
      true if the Stage is in the process of closing itself and all its dependents

    • getDependentsUnmodifiable

      public List<javafx.stage.Stage> getDependentsUnmodifiable()
      Gets a List of Stage that depend on this stage.

      All the Stages in this list will be closed (if they remain open) when this stage closes

      Returns:
      the list of Stages that depend on this Stage

    • registerDependent

      public void registerDependent(javafx.stage.Stage stage)
      Register a stage as a dependent of this stage.

      Any stages which are dependent on this stage and not closed will be closed when this stage closes.

      Parameters:
      stage - the stage that is to be made dependent on this stage

    • deregisterDependent

      public void deregisterDependent(javafx.stage.Stage stage)
      Removes a stage from depending on this stage.

      Once a stage is removed from the dependents it will no longer be closed on the closing of this stage. You can pass any stage to this method and it will remove the object from the list or do nothing if it is not in the list as it delegates to List.remove(Object)

      Parameters:
      stage - the stage to remove from dependents
